content:
Hi there. I find all my users still having those "tutorial" hotspots on their Zulips. They just don't click them.
Is there any way to completelly disable them for all users?
This isn't what you're asking for here, but it's related: #feedback > skip intro tour
There's only like 4 of them; I'm a bit surprised that users haven't clicked them by now.
They are pretty discreet. I seem to remember only spotting them after clicking about a bit.

If you have access to the database, you can remove the tutorial hotspots, manually or programmatically, by setting
zulip.zerver_userprofile.tutorial_status='F'
@Ricardo Duarte FYI, Plankter is correct that you can clear it for users in bulk using a manage.py shell.
I believe UserProfile.objects.all().update(tutorial_status='F') in a management shell would do the job.
